figure_1.title: Figure 1.  Average Altmetric Attention Score (AAS) for each month from years 2012 to 2018.
figure_1.caption: There are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1).

figure_2.title: Figure 2.  Article discussing the use of websites to detect influenza in USA.

claims.sentence:
As shown in
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second highest peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third peak is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1).

Open in a new tabWe found around 49 articles discussing the use of websites to detect influenza in USA (
Figure 2).

During our literature review, we found around 49 articles discussing the use of websites to detect influenza in USA (
Figure 2).

Please provide more details for top articles such as the number of Twitter mentions or the number of Mendeley readers, etc.

Figure 2.
The articles mentioned in figure 2 were retrieved through the same search described in the methods.
You can add standard deviation of table 1 in Figure 1.

I have trouble understanding results, particularly this section. "As shown in 
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1)." What do authors mean by "peak"? As far as I can see from Figure 1, the mean AAS score was highest in February, January, October, September, December in that order.
It seems figure 1 and the reported result are not correlating.
You can add standard deviation of table 1 in Figure 1.

I have trouble understanding results, particularly this section. "As shown in 
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1)." What do authors mean by "peak"? As far as I can see from Figure 1, the mean AAS score was highest in February, January, October, September, December in that order.
It seems figure 1 and the reported result are not correlating.

As shown in
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second highest peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third peak is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1).

I have trouble understanding results, particularly this section. "As shown in 
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1)." What do authors mean by "peak"? As far as I can see from Figure 1, the mean AAS score was highest in February, January, October, September, December in that order.
It seems figure 1 and the reported result are not correlating.
You can add standard deviation of table 1 in Figure 1.

As shown in
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second highest peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third peak is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1).

I have trouble understanding results, particularly this section. "As shown in 
Figure 1, there are three peaks for the AAS; the highest is observed in February with a mean AAS of 1076.5 (±614.6), the second peak is in October with a mean AAS of 831.4 (±441.9), and the third is in June with a mean AAS of 586.2 (±271.1)." What do authors mean by "peak"? As far as I can see from Figure 1, the mean AAS score was highest in February, January, October, September, December in that order.
It seems figure 1 and the reported result are not correlating.
You can add standard deviation of table 1 in Figure 1.
